Package org.radarbase.auth.authorization

Class RadarAuthorization

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radarbase.auth.authorization.RadarAuthorization
  • public final class RadarAuthorization
extends java.lang.Object
    Authorization helper class for RADAR. This class checks if the authenticated user is allowed to access the protected resources of a given subject based on the authorities and project affiliations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Similar to RadarToken.hasAuthority(String) (Permission)}, but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean.

      Similar to RadarToken.hasAuthority(String) (Permission)}, but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean.

      Similar to RadarToken.hasPermission(Permission), but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean.

    • Method Detail

      • checkAuthority

        public static void checkAuthority​(RadarToken token,
                                  java.lang.String authority)
                           throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasAuthority(String) (Permission)}, but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with e.g. Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the requester
        authority - The authority to check
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the authority

      • checkAuthorityAndPermission

        public static void checkAuthorityAndPermission​(RadarToken token,
                                               java.lang.String authority,
                                               Permission permission)
                                        throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasAuthority(String) (Permission)}, but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with e.g. Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the requester
        authority - The authority to check
        permission - Permission that the authority should have.
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the authority

      • checkPermission

        public static void checkPermission​(RadarToken token,
                                   Permission permission)
                            throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasPermission(Permission), but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with e.g. Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the authenticated client
        permission - The permission to check
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the permission

      • checkPermissionOnProject

        public static void checkPermissionOnProject​(RadarToken token,
                                            Permission permission,
                                            java.lang.String projectName)
                                     throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasPermissionOnProject(Permission, String), but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with e.g. Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the logged in user
        permission - The permission to check
        projectName - The project for which to check the permission
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the permission in the given project

      • checkPermissionOnSubject

        public static void checkPermissionOnSubject​(RadarToken token,
                                            Permission permission,
                                            java.lang.String projectName,
                                            java.lang.String subjectName)
                                     throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasPermissionOnSubject(Permission, String, String), but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with e.g. Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the logged in user
        permission - The permission to check
        projectName - The project for which to check the permission
        subjectName - The name of the subject to check
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the permission in the given project for the given subject

      • checkPermissionOnSource

        public static void checkPermissionOnSource​(RadarToken token,
                                           Permission permission,
                                           java.lang.String projectName,
                                           java.lang.String subjectName,
                                           java.lang.String sourceId)
                                    throws NotAuthorizedException
        Similar to RadarToken.hasPermissionOnSource(Permission, String, String, String), but this method throws an exception rather than returning a boolean. Useful in combination with, e.g., Spring's controllers and exception translators.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the logged in user
        permission - The permission to check
        projectName - The project for which to check the permission
        subjectName - The name of the subject to check
        sourceId - The source ID to check
        Throws:
        NotAuthorizedException - if the supplied token does not have the permission in the given project for the given subject and source.
